content.question: If <math alttext="g of x equals, the natural log of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a differentiable function of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is equivalent to the derivative of <math alttext="f of g of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="f prime of open parenthesis, 1 over x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator f prime of x, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f prime of open parenthesis, the natural log of x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator f prime of open parenthesis, the natural log of x, close parenthesis, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator f prime of open parenthesis, the natural log of x, close parenthesis, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
